page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY,THE PEOPLE.
page.content: MOST OF THE VILLAGERS WORKED ON THE LAND OR AS CRAFTSMEN SERVING THE FARMERS. THE FARMING DEPRESSIONS IN THE 19TH CENTURY BOUGHT POVERTY. SOME EMIGRATED IN DESPAIR TO CANADA AND AUSTRALIA. OTHERS, AFTER THE RAILWAY ARRIVED IN 1851 FOUND EMPLOYMENT UN ASHFORD AND RYE. EDUCATION HAS BEEN PROVIDED BY THE CHURCH FOR CENTURIES, AND IN 184O IT BUILT THE PRESENT VILLAGE SCHOOL, GIVING THE CHILDREN THE CHANCE OF WIDER OPPORTUNITIES. APPLEDORE WAS NOT A HEALTHY PLACE FOR MOST OF ITS HISTORY. UNDRAINED MARSHES BROUGHT MARSH FEVER. THE ROYAL MILITARY CANAL DID MUCH TO CURE THIS TROUBLE AND APPLEDORE HAS BECOME A PLACE RO WHICH PEOPLE RETIRE, INTRODUCING A NEW ELEMENT IN THE COMMUNITY, BUT MANY OLD APPLEDORE FAMILIES REMAIN UPHOLDING TRADITIONS.
